nhgIEKwlmNKPJx-2eftCJw.text: Best hibachi spot in Charlotte. Been around for years. Does not have an over the top show with dinner. Which I am okay with, a few tricks are plenty. Food is always fast and fresh. Staff is always friendly. Great family spot.

fBtAvxVfpGgVxRUgnt6D2g.text: Love this place, usually aways busy.  Good Sushi and great Hibachi grill, lobster, chicken, Filet Mignon all great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi!!

wZLTpKaoWINZqgBxMV1Tzg.text: Found this place on yelp as we arrived in charlotte 4pm with our 5 yr old and 2 yr old.  Figured they'd like hibachi...we were right!  Service was great, very kid friendly and helpful.  Food was plentiful.  Our table got a freebie of teriyaki shrimp (maybe they do this for all tables?).  Our party had the chicken and steak selections, all good.   2 adults and 2 kids. We were out the door for $85, including a nice tip.  Small kids will love the chef act!  Make reservations!  We did and we were glad.

-ELcRdB47-DvdGjGTdAxjg.text: My visit to Nakato (first time) was on a Friday night.  The place was packed and had a constant stream of people, busy busy.  We had 6:30 reservations for a party of 6 and once everyone arrived we were promptly seated.  They will not seat you until everyone is there.  We were seated around a hibachi station - each station has seating for 8, so we had two strangers at the end of our station (no big, they were nice).  I was a little concerned at the cost of the meal when I was looking at it online, but the amount of food is well worth the cost.  I ordered the teryaki chicken.  You start with an onion broth while the chef is warming up.  Next is the small chilled garden salad served with a pink creamy dressing.  While you are finishing your soup and working on your salad, the chef starts with hibachi veggies (thin sliced carrots, onions, zucchini, mushrooms and broccoli).  Next are hibachi noodles (spaghetti with an oil and garlic ? coating).  Next, if you order fried rice with your meal ($1.75 extra) instead of white rice, the chef does the fried rice and portions it out.  Then the meat is started.  Our table had a variety of steak and shrimp items, which were served first since they cook more quickly than chicken (no one wants rare chicken).  I thought everything was quite good (though my white rice was cold, but that is what I get for not ordering fried rice like everyone else at the table).  All of the preparation is done in front of you by the chef, who puts on a show while cooking.  Very interesting, though I was concerned that I was going to lose my eyebrows when the onion volcano was done.  With 6 people, it was hard to hold a conversation, though not impossible.  If you are catching up with friends, I would suggest getting there early for drinks, or planning drinks and dessert after - once the chef's show starts going, along with all of the tables around you, it is rather noisy.    Our server kept drinks filled.  The chef was quite personable.  I had water to drink, so my dinner before tip was just under $15.  Contrary to what my dinner date told me, you don't necessarily have to take off your shoes, though they do have traditional tables there as an option.    Be warned that your hair and clothes will reek of the hibachi smell, so I wouldn't take a post-meal walk through the woods unless you like bears and wildcats.

vZWKCHTCclkR6CYYY7NwIg.text: Great food, great service! I think this might be my wife's new favorite restaurant.  Sushi tastes fresher than most of the other places in the area, though their selection is a bit limited.  We will definitely be coming back.

M_PLdaUZmfYXRO3lmK9efQ.text: The food was okay, but the atmosphere and service was very strange. Our hibachi chef seemed stressed out and rushed. He didnt interact with our table at all which in turn led to a more awkward meal. Even with the flaming onion tower that every hibachi place does, he coulndt do that so he just set our whole table on fire ( literally) and just made noises while doing so. It was strange to say the least. Also the portions were extremely small especially for a hibachi restaurant. All in all i was very disappointed in this restaurant, nothing has changed since the remodel i guess.

-7JkV0LWQaX6eo76xW39ww.text: I've seriously never eaten here and been able to eat my whole meal.  I'm partial to the combination plates, either the steak and chicken or the shrimp.  All three are great choices that you can't go wrong with.  My favorite parts of the meal are the noodles I think.  They are down right delicious probably from the butter used to cook them.  Don't come here on a diet, you will be in trouble.  Another thing to note is it's probably good to get a reservation because the place stays busy.  But if you don't, don't fret.  We recently did an impromptu visit and even though they stated an hour long wait it was really only 30 minutes.  I think they are just managing expectations.

A0olEm_oprNwagTzX9F1DA.text: Average food. You can tell they use cheap steak and lobster. The sauces are not good and they are constantly rushing you. I literally had my soup and salad delivered within 30 seconds of each other. Then the chef comes out to rush us. The server is stuck constantly refilling tiny glasses and trying to rush us so we have room for hot food from the chef. The chef was entertaining but the food wasn't very good. Large portions of noodles and vegetables. I guess they want big portions to make up for poor quality. Doesn't work. Then the server comes out to rush us into boxing up our food. The very minute the chef is done! How about we get some time to eat and talk?!? Boxes were left at the table while we were still eating so that The server could return to constantly filling tiny glasses. We wanted to make sure the chef got tipped out, but came to find he splits them with the server... even. That is just wrong. The servers are running around hustling people through dinner so they can get the next table in.    The place cuts too many corners and rushes you through dinner. It's not very good. And they take advantage of the wait staff. Did I mention the hostesses were rude? Find somewhere better to eat.

RymTQMidMD5UCvzkEbDx-g.text: My husband and I came here on a Wednesday night because we had a Groupon for $30 worth of food.  The Groupon said to call ahead with a reservation and to  mention the Groupon, so at 6pm I called, and was told the earliest they could take me was 7. I thought it was odd being so full on a weeknight, but fine with the time. It seemed like they were really busy because it was hard to talk to the hostess, who seemed in a rush to get off the phone.   We arrived around 10 til 7 and were immediately seated. We were sat (very close to) a group that was already there at another grilling station. We waited on the rest of our people to get there and I actually felt a little smashed between my husband and a 12 year old from another party. I feel like they had 1 too many chairs for the table.   Our waiter was Quinn. He was pretty nice, but I think he had at least 1 other table, because we saw him few and far between. It seemed like the waitress serving the table next to us was a bit quicker, but who knows what was happening behind the scenes.   I ordered the Teryaki steak, and my husband got the Teryaki chicken. It comes with a shrimp appetizer, soup, salad, vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, carrots, and mushrooms), and white rice (you can get an order of fried rice for $1.75 extra).   I thought the shrimp was good, and the chef did a little trick flipping the shrimp tails into a used bowl, one into his pocket, and one into his hat. This was probably the only time he showed off. The chef at the other table flipped around the egg, where as our chef cracked them on the grill. The other chef, just seemed like he was having a fun time with it, our chef seemed not thrilled.   The steak and vegetables, noodles, and rice were all good. Not great, I think if we were paying full price for this, I would have not enjoyed our $40 bill. We did also try Saki for the first time (not a fan).   We will go back - if we have another Groupon or coupon.

725w_9y8YNHIZJFPga7BZQ.text: We walked in on a Friday night without a reservation. They were able to seat us very quickly. The service was great and our chef Alan was very entertaining and cooked the food perfectly. I ordered the vegetable dinner and they seriously give you A LOT of veggies! The environment was very comfortable too. We will be back!

spDlauTiUd-rmDFVND6zgw.text: We went on a Friday night at 9:15pm for hibachi.  The server was SLOW, and we were getting impatient, but once we got the order placed and the cook arrived, the rest of the meal went smoothly and it was tasty.  I will say that they seem to have greatly increased the portion of noodles and greatly reduced the portion of vegetables both in the fried rice as well as the side dishes in the main meal, which was unfortunate.

3fgTEf7Rwwo7mlEEkQcfyQ.text: Very busy place for rather mediocre food. We rarely eat at hibachi grills, but decided it sounded good tonight. The food was okay. Life's too short and there are way too many good things to eat to settle for okay!  I think one thing that makes it tricky when reviewing a hibachi experience is that they all basically have the same menu - right down to the salad dressing!  Therefore, comparisons are natural.   I found the soup salty. The salad dressing was okay, but missing something. Rice was good, noodles had a nice garlic flavor and veggies were standard. I ordered the teriyaki steak and it had zero teriyaki flavor. Had the sauce not been visible I would have sworn I got the wrong item. The meat itself did not taste good. It wasn't spoiled tasting, more like a really cheap cut of meat. I only ate about three bites.  In another environment I would have gone so far as to complain, but not here.  The shrimp were good. Maybe most disappointing was the ubitiqous white shrimp sauce. It was very watery and bland:(. Major disappointment as that stuff is the highlight of a hibachi visit!  In sum, the food was filling, but not good enough to come here again.    The positives are that the staff were friendly and worked quickly. The chef gave extra attention to my young son which was kind of him. Portions were quite large.  I cannot imagine complaints about portion size!

TgO_bpAulL62nCvVkDjWzw.text: Overall, a great Sushi restaurant.  Warm towel to clean your hands when you first sit down.  Very attentive service by both the waitress and the Sushi chef.  Quality sushi even though they have a lot of focus on the hibachi table service.  Prices are in line with the quality food you get, so a good value.  Definitely a recommend to try solo or with family for sushi.  I haven't experienced their hibachi tables so I'll leave that for others to rate.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Check out the quality ingredients of the Miso soup.

tV8wYR5Wlql1phVkZExwmg.text: I was so excited to make reservations for my boyfriend's birthday at our favorite restaurant. When our party arrived a few minutes ahead of us (to be there early to surprise my boyfriend) the hostess said she couldn't find our reservation and suggested the other Japanese steakhouse down the street.  I know for a fact that I made the reservation, but the hostess argued that I did not. Our party was asked to wait almost 30 minutes past the reservation time due to this issue.    Once seated, the food and drinks were great.  The server and chef were very efficient and personable.

4qaHe652evfwiLCIxUMMyA.text: Good food, good service, sushi I'm told is great. Often times a long wait without reservations. Can't say I'd bother if not already in the area.

dTl9GHxiFDCvZb8_roeCmA.text: Family friendly atmosphere. Server Kristy kept our drinks refilled promptly. My teenage son mentioned he would love to have his birthday party here. I guess it passed "teen test." Our party ordered the hibachi chicken. Portions were large and yummy. Easy to get reservations, but needed on a Friday night.

Npg43ovwJJ4L4npyLraHZg.text: My husband and I are sushi lovers and we sat at the sushi bar. The sushi chef Jin was very experienced and delivered some delicious rolls and nigiri.. The management was also friendly and conversational, checking on us in addition to our waitress.. We had NO wait time and loved the beer specials! $2.75 Sapporo on thursdays!

TDNs4x79xQd_GooYKK7Jxg.text: Far better than it's competition just down the street! I've eaten here many times and have never once had a single complaint! The quality and quantity of the food is fantastic! The sushi is superb! The staff are welcoming and efficient! The only thing I would tweak would be the decor. The carpet should be removed because I've been coming here for years and it's always been the same, and only gotten darker. I realize that seems like no big deal, but I would feel better about the whole experience with a new floor that's easier to clean.

oDEkdzGA2r1kcoUevbOBBQ.text: Love this place! Great for birthdays, small or large groups, or just as a couple. The price is a bit high but, it's one of the best dining experiences you can have - if you like hibachi style food. The food is just awesome - the chefs cook right in front of you - they put on a little show - it's pretty impressive.

9Ie8GyT5iJ8emzdZNkVpzg.text: The only complaint-make a reservation and by far the food is well worth the wait.  I have never went to Japanese where noodles and rice was served with your meal. Vegetables included carrots, mushrooms the norm zucchini and onions.  The staff was great! The food was excellent!

l3KNo04t4NQsXd_C-Lqv_w.text: Honestly love this place but take out is HORRIBLE I will never ever do take out from here! Dining in perfect but they screw up the orders and make a big deal when they messed up!

zhKnQqSKseDj5hOcvYpygw.text: 12 minutes before sever came to get our drink order had to go tell hostess to get us a server. Before I got to her she spoke loud enough 25ft away Saying "your server is on his way" after seeing me coming. Then the server arrived and took drink order and said to make it easy are you ready to place your entire order? Very poor experience

YfhH8K7bj9TsPOW8ULXR0g.text: "Go For Show, Not For The Food"  We took our son there for his birthday. While they put on a good show that the kids will enjoy, the prices and proportions are horrible. We got there for the early bird special which is chicken and beef for $13.85. Now you get soup, salad, shrimp appetizer, noodles, rice, and your meat. Now heres were they get you. You get white rice or pay $2 more to substitute for fried rice. They give you a little strip of chicken and a little strip of beef. Don't get me wrong, you won't leave hungry, just full from all the filler food I listed above not the meat. The cheapest kids meals are $9 each. My total bill for the five of us was $75 before tip. The waitress let my wife's and my water run out 3 times. We will go back again for special occasion, but will get kids something before hand so not paying $36 for 4 kids meals.

0IVQWSWL08YLT4gvAoWDIA.text: Lucky we were there earlier so did not wait.  Food was good and it was fun to look at chef cooking in front of you.

9TbHxqYeQB_Vi8M4BdvHmA.text: I would have giving it 5 stars but the part service sucked so much... the woman who took our order was rushing and being very pushy so the table can order... the food was great our Hibachi serve was great very friendly and entertaining!!!

68Q8Zkxpmk68qm3pnVOpTw.text: We took our friends to dinner here last week. They are moving to Germany and they chose this restaurant.   I don't normally like hibachi food, but I was very impressed with this place! The entire experience was just really fun. The waitstaff is extremely professional,  and the chef did little things to make the kids laugh.   I did not eat any sushi as I don't enjoy it, but the shrimp and chicken was high quality and seasoned well. I ordered the veggie dinner, and with the noodles and rice I was stuffed to the brim. We also had ice cream and some fried banana type of dessert. This will be one of our new go to places!

luLKvJ7mzH47EGXrWOGR1Q.text: We went for dinner with friends. It's hibachi and sushi place.we tried couple of hibachi items sitting in front of cooking place.The food is really delicious.  I have tried shrimp tempura,chicken noodles with mixed vegetables everything is great. In the menu they have different kind of  Asian beers too. it's good place to go with entire family and having dinner.

-zCdSZIQhmehmbpKwAFozg.text: One of my familiy's favorite places to eat. Ever. Armed with this knowledge I was bracing myself for an... interesting experience. Hibachi is generally standard across the board for me. It's not a hit or miss type of cuisine. In terms of the actual hibachi, everyone does the same exact thing with some minor twists here and there, so it's all about the quality of ingredients and service. Lets just say I held my toungue when asked how I liked my meal at the end of the day.  The Service: - A little slow honestly, it took them forever to get my beer (not cool bro) and even longer to come get my order. Friendly people as per the usual, but for some reason they are on asian standard time when it comes to serving you.  The Food: - Standard hibachi food, solid but nothing special. A big plus for me are the portions. They tend to give you larger portions than other restaurants along with the traditional soup, salad, shrimp, and veggies. In fact, this is the only place I've seen that gives you noodles with your dish at no extra cost. Well played Nakato.   The Ambiance - Gotta love the ambiance. My cook was playful and had fun with the kids (which is a must, they love attention). The decor was great, modern with a little rustic feel to make you ease into your surroundings.   Overall, wouldn't jump the gun saying its the best hibachi I've ever had, but I also won't be coming here regularly.

4mmHoSyRr9jM3YdNcBRnVw.text: Did the hibachi here.  It was some of the best hibachi I have had in CLT.  Our chef was latin american and did some tricks we have never seen before.  Also, he was just damn good at his job.  Food was great and the pricepoint was around $23 a person.  I will def come back

xFcC_Du23ETohWATIPVy_Q.text: I've been to Nakato several times and it has been a great experience every time.  This is on the top of my list and totally convenient to our house.

U3uBz6ZMF2xf5nJRn85LDg.text: Great experience. We went to celebrate my wife birthday.  Everybody had a good time with great meal. Portion on every dish are plenty. About service  excellent. .!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half way on my entree

N7pF-D6iTZ6zanyqU_E3_g.text: Absolutely top scores in my book! This place is always very inviting the smell of the food the aroma that hit you when you walk in the door is mouthwatering. The sushi is outstanding and the service is always perfect. I've eaten there so many times I cannot count, but I have never had a bad experience in over 20 years of  eating at this restaurant. This is absolutely one of my favorite places because I know how careful they are with their food preparation and the fact that the place is spotless, and exceptionally good service. By the way I always check the bathrooms before I actually sit down to eat in a place, and their bathrooms would get an A rating from me.

8nA7FrVkMUdxniCv4Vx2ng.text: We tried out this place tonight, and overall it was a nice dinner. I will say I was disappointed mostly in the prices. In comparison to other hibachi restaurants nearby, the entree prices were definitely pricier. Word to the wise: entrees comes with steamed rice, but fried rice is an extra charge... which I've never seen a hibachi place do. Our server was very kind and attentive, and our chef was personable and engaging, but overall, I didnt feel the food was worth the price.

gfak8twBuSLtGHW8GsGwSw.text: I'm not a huge fan of the hibachi experience, but it's a fun change of pace when you don't feel like talking during dinner. haha. I always order the vegetarian because I'm usually full by the time the entree is ready. Decent cocktails, ok wine and beer selection. Fun for the kids. There's definitely better Japanese cuisine in Charlotte but this one is good for a Japanese steakhouse format.

WD_mhY4xDknUIUyumVyRow.text: This experience was not quite as good as the first. Our chef was great but the place was more crowded and besides the wait to be seated, we sat for a while before being served. My glass sat empty not once but twice.

T9DUvDltkCdAkLK-CwXlYw.text: Very good, I used to come here every Sunday after I praised God #gojesus. The food is always Delicious and the servers are very entertaining to the children, and they are very friendly, I also had a birthday there and it was very good and they gave me free cake and they took a picture of my group for free, I would recommend this to any hibachi lover like me!!

dRGzdJKFoD6YRTGPBT5QbQ.text: Loved and love this place.. Unique experience. food is great and so is ambiance !

yUamHF_tkuUreMxq-cBa2w.text: I didn't really like the good. It didn't have a lot of flavor. I feel like I wasted my hunger, time, and money. Won't go back. The waitress was super sweet however the guy cooking was an ass. When asked if he could remove onions for certain people he said gave a mean look and said too late

ptddvNrAUslxy98_jSci1Q.text: Food was great and very entertaining to watch. The Shrimp and Chicken was the best. Will go back next time !!!

GZeKakR6-6h9P7dr81lm4w.text: Don't go here unless you are with a large group...we waited over 40 minutes and were never seated as a party of two

i3WC01dPaPF11qI5Th_bsQ.text: Food was good! I went to Nakatos to eat sushi and it was pretty good. I wear retainers and unfortunately I took them out and left them wrapped in a napkin on the table. I left the restaurant for 5 mins and they had cleaned the table and threw they away. I tried to see if I could go into the trash myself to retrieve the retainers as they were 1200 and I was told by the general manager that I couldn't go in and search for them myself. He was extremely insensitive. I'm out of 1200. Won't be going back.

vI-psyA9OcCkIzGfWdNiMA.text: What happened to the days of good Hibachi Steakhouses? I had to give one star for the following reasons: 1. They charge $1.85 for rice. You can get steamed white rice included with the meal. Generally it's the fried rice included but nope. Don't be surprised when your bill is $1.85 more than you expected. 2. Our chef threw his utensil across the table in the first 3 mins of his cooking. -__- 3. I told him I'd like to not have noodles. He said, "you still have to pay for it." -I know sir. 4. When flipping the chicken, he threw a whole tender sized piece onto the table. Just left it there...didn't get another piece. Too bad to the folks getting chicken. You're just short. 5. Luckily I got shrimp. It was extremely dry, unluckily.   My table's experience was bad. Hopefully it was just an off night, but I won't be going back.

QIB2RLC16DINFj2uxicNcQ.text: Pretty upset with this restaurant. I came for the Early Bird Special. But, they will not serve it tonight because they are out of that particular cut of beef. Management refuses to substitute another cut of beef or add extra chicken or any alternative. Funny that when a restaurant tells me "too bad",  I never return.

buZCa-RkKBJqlp-TIvIzaQ.text: My partner and I just left Outback right across the street due to a horrible experience before we even ordered so we decided to tryout Nakato.  We were immediately sat at the sushi bar because it was an hour wait to sit at a hibachi family style table where the chef cooks in front of you.    We were greeted in a timely manner, drink orders taken and drinks received timely.  Sushi was ordered then waitress disappears. I see the manager running around like a chicken with his head cut off to only further observe the employees he hired and is paying are standing  around and literally flickering their lighters, yes one server was literally standing around flicking a lighter.    We finally get the sushi, the I asked to order the filet and jumbo prawn for my partner and I, each.  (Mind you it's the most expensive for the combo per person, for the items listed at $28 a piece)  The server argued with me that they didn't have it. I pulled out the menu and pointed. I think there was a language barrier. Next, I tell her what kind of soup and salad I want, as the entrees are supposed to come with soup ,salad, shrimp appetizer, everything you would get as if you sat at a table where the cooks actually cooking front of you.  She said if we want the soup, salad etc we would have to sit at the table where they cook In front of you. I asked what else came with it then, she said nothing only rice and meat.    Soooooooo, for the same menu item, same price you are not giving us the same accompaniments that would you would get normally because we are sitting at the sushi bar? Ridiculous.  I said bring the bill for the sushi and we are outta here.  It took another 15 minutes to get out bill which I had to flag the manager down for.  Never will we return.  This was the second restaurant the tried for my partners 30th birthday.

O9yZDO6UrjbrSx6QtL9yIQ.text: Good meal today at Nakatos.  Walked in no wait. Plenty of food and enough to take home.  Hibachi shrimp and steak was great.  Love that shrimp sauce

rtQ4eRbwESfDyAEmjrFr2Q.text: I really don't care what others may say about this type or even this specific restaurant. No gourmet, nothing fancy, and smoke in the air.....this is our favorite place to eat in Charlotte/ Pineville area.  Soup, salad, shrimp appetizer, noodles, vegetables, fried or steamed rice, and your main course (I always get filet-rare).  My family absolutely loves this place. Always attentive service and chef. Always need a box for leftovers. Plain and simple....relaxing and great fun for the kids.  Side Note: I love the green apple hot sake

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Here we go!!!!!
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Boom!!!!

Btnyqn1oJUJhczhx4U0Wrw.text: We asked our 15 year old where he wanted to go for his Birthday Dinner and he said a Japanese Steakhouse.  We've been to both Nakato and Kabuto and both are good, but Nakato stands out a bit more for us so that's what we decided on.  We arrived at 5pm on a Sunday night and didn't expect much of a wait so imagine our surprise when the waiting area was full and they said it was a 45 minute wait.  Oh well, it was what it was AND it was my son's bday so we waiting...and waited....and waited.  Finally, after 50 long minutes, they called our name.    We were seated in the "traditional" teppanyaki room and that was a first for us.  We loved it!  It was a bit awkward to get into, but worth it.  I've been trying to watch my weight so instead of the massive feeding frenzy of the traditional hibachi meal,. I had a bowl of the Onion Soup, a side of Edammame and the Tuna Tataki appetizer (portion was entree-sized!).  All of it was very good!  My family had the steak and chicken hibachi meals and loved it all.  My son especially loves the "Yum Yum" sauce (the pink sauce) and has me convinced that he would eat "anything" if he could dip it in Yum Yum sauce!    We opted for the $10.00 birthday package.  The package included a birthday cake (Pepperidge Farms vanilla cake) with a candle, a family photo in a souvenir cardboard frame (came out awesome, BTW), and the waitstaff sang Happy Birthday in English and Japanese.  Well worth the $10, in my opinion!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Family photo taken as part of the &#34;birthday package&#34;.  Nice memento from a special occasion dinner.

Mw1CT6oArDi6iVhz48ljLQ.text: Came here for the first time and loved it. Been to many Habachi grills and this one is high-quality and very good service. I got the steak and chicken and both are very good. The cook had a great personality made the experience fun.highly recommend if you're looking for a good Habachi grill in Charlotte

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Habachi style

sPFdNT49fqLR1hOipOAz6A.text: My family and I went here while visiting North Carolina, and we were very happy. Which started by sitting at the sushi bar which is a note that they put sushi on and you pick it up and choose what you want as the boat goes by. And of course you can always request Sushi from the chef. We requested some and we had some off the boat and they were both fantastic. Not sure who the sushi chef was but he definitely knew what he was doing. After sitting at the sushi bar for a while we went to the Hibachi area for the rest of our meal. The food tasted great the ship was very entertaining and we all just had a really great time. I will definitely be coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Philadelphia roll, and I&#39;m not sure what that other role is to be honest that was the one my fiancé ordered
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi moat!!

a0lWTsM6ota9BNzyRHJjmg.text: I've been coming here since 98' and it's been consistently excellent since then! This is the finest hibachi style restaurant in Charlotte.

DyiCIalhL8elyc7Ov9sxsA.text: Partytime!  Everyone knows you take your kid to Chuck E. Cheese for birthday parties, well take the grandparents to Nakato! It's loud, fun and they have delicious food. The bar is located in the front (aka the waiting room because lots of large parties come in). They have tables, traditional Hibachi rooms and large tables with the same Hibachi grill. It might be chilly once you walk in, but the flat top heats you up. I went with the family for my grandmother's birthday and we got hibachi meals.  FOOD: You start with some soup, which to me was delicious but to most is probably just salty water with some onions. They also give a small salad. Next up is whatever you want! Each protein is served with veggies, noodles and rice (steamed or fried). Everyone gets some soy sauce and shrimp sauce as well. Seafood, steak or chicken are the main protein choices. I also noticed it's super easy to ask for no butter or oil in your meal so it's very easy to request a low sodium, low fat healthy meal. It was my grandmother's birthday so we got a cake that comes with a very loud sound and painfully american Japanese version of "if you're happy and you know it." Is it just a vanilla cake with some sprinkles? Yeah. Is it amazing and fluffy and light and worth saving room for? Absolutely. You also get a cute picture to take home.  The chefs' talent is really what makes the whole experience. They will interact with who interacts with them. So, please, put the phone down and enjoy the onion volcano they set on fire. It's fun and definitely makes a birthday special.

KRq1L-L2Q86hQ8fm71zG5A.text: WHO IS THE OWNER OF THIS PLACE? Today I had the worst experience with this place. I called earlier and made a reservation for 6 people. I was told the only time they had was 8:30pm. As soon as we get there we checked in with the front desk person telling them all of our party was there. We arrived 20 minutes before our actual time. At 8:35 a family with 7 people just walk inside the restaurant and was seated right away. We could not believe it!!! As we ask the front lady why, she said our table will be ready soon with a sarcastic smile. We ask to talk to the manager and I never, ever had a manager talking to me like that... my husband walked away from the restaurant and my family and I got a table. How rude this man was to us. The manager also want to dictate on what chair we should be seating... really? NO. I will be seating in front of the grill and you put whoever you want on the side table. He said that I should leave if I was not compliant with the restaurant rules... Serious? who is the owner of this restaurant? I don't think they have a clue what is going on there. They laugh on my face and treat my family and  I as crap. Food is good , but they lost easily a family of 6. Something has to change with the front desk people. Specially the manager that has no clue how to treat a customer. My kids cried and got scared with the manager attitude. Not fair and not acceptable.

vecV7RHHPmwy5b1KzYDIOQ.text: The food was great! I had the steak and shrimp, and it was awesome. The atmosphere is casual. I loved seeing the chef cook the food in front of me.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

RmffRp9PmPIivOdXb9OzDw.text: You should defiantly come here if your white and Privileged! Had the worst service ever from Brooke she was too worried about the other folks at our table to even fill our cup while empty!  Had to ask for every thing even for drinks and clearing table. David ( the manager) did his best to defend an under cover raciest. Only drove 1:15 minutes for the worst service ever! Just thought I would put it out there.

tbR6UioKUJNRjnuJXF4d6w.text: Absolutely amazing!  This is my place to stop anytime I'm in town.   It's boarder line addictive at best.  The show,  food quality, quantity and environment is perfect whether dinning alone or with others.   I've tried most of the menu and not disappointed once.   Friendly staff!!  I wish to rank them lower for the wait sometimes but it's so worth it!!!

jP3329nF_E-NunXtEaZwWg.text: Always an amazing experience when we go. Would give it 5 stars but even with reservations there is always a wait. Food is great an the chefs  always entertain. Dinner does come with a shrimp appetizer, soup and salad

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

Cju2-cDMtMG4yhxt7lF0cA.text: Manager is very rude and unwilling to accommodate! He made it clear he did not want us there and made every excuse to not help our party of 11. I will never return!

LXCX2cjpgCZUs0VlO166ow.text: First time guests, we missed our old Japanese steakhouse back home.  We were not disappointed.  We sat at the hibachi and our chef did an awesome job.  The soup was fantastic, rich and so flavorful.  My husband had steak and scallops, he said it was delicious.  I had the filet steak and shrimp.  The filet was cooked perfectly and was as tender as any steak I've had at a high end steakhouse.  I don't know what they do with their noodles...but they were the best I've ever had.  There was a bit of a wait to be seated, as was expected for a Saturday night and without a reservation.  We enjoyed a glass of wine at the bar and the wait was definitely worth it.  Can't wait to visit again!

VeTBK6aYBaRM9ZMtxkRsCg.text: Multiple things to consider if you go there  1. Be prepared to wait a while - Called ahead to reserve; half the party reached 15 mins early; rest reached 2 mins past reservation time. But they couldn't find us our tables until 30 mins later. What's the point of reservations ? 2. Food is sub-par but you pay too much for the food they serve  My advice : avoid it and find some place where they care about you as a customer

vT8Msu3oE_lfQ6tMR5cUrA.text: After several years, and two recent visits Nakato is still a solid 4 stars! From the servers, always friendly and several around to assist with everything, to the food and entertainment. The menu has a wide variety of items, including sushi, which definitely accommodates any customer. And, expect a lot of it...most people leave with to go boxes. One thing to keep in mind, depending on what time you go, expect a 30-60 minute wait. But there is a large waiting area with a nice bar to grab a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flaming onion!
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

OVS4Pr1mPCE1MipXZKwEng.text: My dinner group met here because this place has been recommended to me as one of the best Japanese steakhouses in Charlotte and I had to see the sushi boats for myself.   I arrived early and sat at the bar. The bartender and hostess staff is quite helpful.  Our group was seated at one of the hibachi grills. Our server was nice but she was a bit slow and a bit off with some of orders but I think she corrected all but one issue.  Your meal comes with soup, salad and then your entree which is cooked in stages. Everyone gets 2 pieces of shrimp to start off. Then you get your veggies and rice, and then the proteins. The hibachi chef puts on a great show for you from balancing and egg on his spatula to creating a fire in front of you.  The food was great and it's worth the entertainment you receive. On my next visit I want to try the sushi bar where there are boats that circle a bar where you can select your sushi. Sounds like fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

mN2M2VjeyHT7TwEnwZCYKQ.text: Great restaurant and people.  The wait was a little long, but the place seems to be very popular.  We met several who were regulars--the wait staff were great. I love hibachi grill, this place did not disappoint.  You go for the show at the grill, and they give you plenty--my girl friend ended up taking a doggy bag.  Several parties, celebrating birthdays and anniversaries!  Great place for the family.   I heard their sushi is great, so will have to go back to give a try.

JydwswWlDuAhXUFPKWIyrw.text: Service was good but unfortunately food was not. Rice and noodles were VERY bland. Ordered the combo of chicken and shrimp. Nothing special about chicken but shrimp had great flavor. Overall, gave 2 stars because of shrimp. Miso soup was also very delicious and refreshing

c1dcNVCDKsv_BkXLsHRR7Q.text: Had the hibachi shrimp and chicken combo at Nakato, and wasn't impressed. The shrimp was NOT deveined. And I don't mean one tiny vein in one shrimp - every piece of shrimp had a large vein running right through it, very prominently visible. It was horrible, not to mention we could've been really sick if we hadn't noticed it. The manager was nice enough to give us more chicken to replace the shrimp and also gave us a few $ off, but that does compensate for their negligence in deveining the shrimp. Also, the zucchini was over cooked, and the rest of the food was mediocre. If you want the hibachi grill experience, this is a great place! If you want good food along with it, not so much.

AC1VDPkTntpyGM8iEHEBzQ.text: I went with a 2 - 2.5 might be more accurate.....   not a fan of nickel and diming - so to charge a couple of extra bucks for fried rice (at a Japanese place!!!) then not bring you the steamed rice that was supposedly included with the meal is annoying -  but some people will not care about that so let's focus on the food....      I got the shrimp & chicken, the chicken was actually both seasoned and cooked very well (not over cooked and dry) - the shrimp however had so little taste that when I shared with my 4 year old she said, "is that real food, or are you pretendin'?"  I said, "yes - why?"... her reply, "because it doesn't taste like anything!!".   The soup was extra good, the salad average at best (I make a much better ginger dressing)!!!   My daughter said the noodles were good but she also thinks McDonald's nuggets are good......  My wife got steak (strip) and I tried it and it was pretty good...   ALL portion sizes were tiny (except the shrimp appetizer- it was the normal 2 shrimp)..  I was here for a birthday dinner - and sort of glad I came - it reinforces to me that Tsuki is 10x better at minimum -food quality, taste, portion size and price (no nickel & diming)...

gZ778vZETWlyC2J1YOYKXA.text: Excellent Japanese Food!  Our favorite:  Hibatchi Chicken & Shrimp!  The food is fresh and their fried rice is amazing. The sushi is pretty good too, we usually get two rolls to share as our appetizers.  The service is great too.  This has easily become our favorite go to spot when craving hibatchi.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

5mqq8lPOyhkFemFvh6Wm0A.text: Recent update:- I recently visited this restaurant again, I noticed a strange thing.. I guess staff who allocates your table based on races. This can be working well for the smooth delivery of service, but being a regular here I noticed this clearly and felt little blue.  Food is tasty. Well sauteed and great for your asian tastebuds. I loved the artistic way of sauteing the veggies and all shrimp and chicken.  Our chef was funny he cut the veggies and chicken by his sharpie knife so smoothly; it's charming absolutely amazing to watch.  The only thing I felt that I wish the food was little less oily.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

zuIoNbcL88OKXLv2Hrz1Uw.text: The staff is always friendly and I always leave with a full stomach and a good laugh.   The food always seems fresh and the chef is always interactive with the customers which makes it a better experience especially if you're there for a special occasion.

Z4PyOcoDDvAaAit5BIE-DA.text: I came with family on a weeknight, no wait, though most tables were full. A few members wanted hibachi, so I sat at the grill even though I was eating sushi only. This review is mostly for the sushi - which I've definitely had better for the price. I got the hot lava roll, the hope roll, and the dragon roll. The hot lava roll was described to have scallops on top, but I couldn't taste the scallops or really anything on or inside the roll because it was drenched, and I mean drenched in mayo sauce. And this was at least $13... just no. The dragon roll came with only 4 pieces? Not sure if that was a mistake or just my fault not reading the menu. Perhaps I just ordered the wrong things but I wouldn't come here again for sushi. The hibachi looked good; the chefs are talented and put on a semi-entertaining show. However to be priced at almost 20 dollars... it's not that much food. Service was fine. But overall not worth it for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. hot lava roll
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. hope roll

uNnTWv5pEhfZ847NPgDefw.text: Loved my visit here! I had the veggie hibachi. It was full of flavor and lots of veggies. The chef was super interactive with everyone at the table. He made sure to get to know everyone and if it was their first time. The portions are not  too large and you get noodles with it. I can't wait to go back.

fzpbnIQCXEyhsikbE1PYHQ.text: They have WiFi but don't let anyone have access to it. When I asked them about it they were rude and wouldn't get the manager when I requested to speak to him. The food and chefs are good but the other staff are rude, it's sometimes dirty, and they aren't very accommodating.

XoatssFNpwrjJSNT2Np0JA.text: Delicious sushi. Tried the spiderman roll and tango roll. Don't get the veggie tempura.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spiderman and tango.

KSVLiMmWB9z2DAprd6QuxA.text: Hostess named Lizzie gave terrible customer service. Refused my family at first bc we had to wait on one family member and we explained our situation. The restaurant policy is a party could not be sat unless all members are present. However my daughter was less than 5 minutes away. Fortunately the manager made an exception for us. Lizzie needs to be fired or moved to be a dishwasher. She is not the right person in that position as hostess. Great manager. Great waitress. Great chef. Terrible hostess for refusing a customer. Did she not learn what customer service is?

6i8JNBu0tih0Q1sosW5pjA.text: So this review is based on solely the sushi FYI. I wanted to branch out and try sushi somewhere other than my normal spot and randomly picked here. My husband and I shared the Hope, Volcano, 49er and caterpillar rolls and they were all so fresh and flavorful. The sushi chef Chris was super friendly and definitely an added bonus to talk to while at the bar. We will be back for sushi for sure and probably try the hibachi at some point.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Volcano, Caterpillar, 49er and Hope rolls. All delicious!!

EmMAn0yGJ50RAe0CYOEvKw.text: Visited here after having a not-so-good experience elsewhere and I was glad that I did. Our server was nice and the cook made sure our orders were correct and had the server bring more shrimp as soon as he realized that there was small mix-up.   Also, if you're a fan of sake and/or have never tried and don't want to break the bank, they offer $4 Gekkeikan served warm/cold. As with any hibachi, the price per plate is going to be around the $20 range but it's well worth it, considering how much food you receive.   The only drawback, the closeness of the table to the grill and all the smoke (if sitting right in front of the chef) will have your clothes smelling like food afterwards. But being the fat kid that I am... I take it (lol)!   Definitely coming back!

o1fTQED3GvG5ALcZM5gQhw.text: Worst sushi I've ever had.. praying I don't get sick from the crap they served before I sent it back.. yuk

HaEWzEj6NqmG0a4Kp6lb5g.text: Went here on a week night around 5:30 and they were surprisingly busy but got us in right away. We ordered sushi appetizers and got them very quickly. The chef that cooked our hibachi meal was very very friendly (more so than a typical chef) and funny! The food was so plentiful and delicious! We ate about half and had enough for another entire meal as leftovers! I would definitely come here again for hibachi!

UXUUKD2QK_mP2ZLxDNvAUQ.text: Tonight was a very interesting dining experience. Once I took my seat, the waiter was very kind and polite. While waiting for the chef, I was able to learn a lot about the girl sitting next me. Not because I asked her, but because she talked so loud to the person sitting right beside her.  I found out she is an Ardrey Kell Senior, who does not have a date to Sadie's. She has no idea what to do because her best friend cannot go with just her. She did not fail to mention that one of her other "friends" is worried about going to college next year, because she won't apply to any scholarships but does not want her parents to pay for it all, even though they just bought two brand new Mercedes Benz, for a total of 5 cars in their garage. I was also delighted to know she enjoys drinking sprite with a little bit of tequila on the weekends.  Our chef did minimal tricks, but the food was fulfilling. However, the MVP of the night was our waiter. Through all the unnecessary information I heard tonight, he managed to be the most attentive server at a Japanese steakhouse that I have ever had.  The night ended with the 17 year old tequila drinker, bumping into my legs, and instead of her saying sorry, she simply walked away. Perhaps if she wasn't so rude, she could find a Sadie's date .  I give this review a 5/5 simply off our waiter Matt. Thank you for making my least favorite experience at a steakhouse, something worth reviewing.

I0W6fGXVZtNHPFQJwPJqpA.text: Lesson learned. DO NOT SIT AT THE SUSHI BAR if you are getting food from the grill. This was an impromptu celebration night for us when we decided to go to one of our favorite places but the wait for 2 was an hour and a half. We talked for a second and decided to sit at the sushi bar instead and just order from there. What they don't tell you is that you get half the food if you order there than you would if you sat at one of the regular tables..for $2 less. Not happy that we paid $12 for something I could have gotten for $7 at any other quick Japanese place.   The waitress we had was rude and short. I get that they were busy but they are always crazy busy on the weekend and I've seen her there for years so I know she is accustomed to that. I don't appreciate being told no when we ask for something extra and say we know there is a charge. Because of a diet program, we wanted all vegetables instead of rice and said we knew there would be a charge but she flat out said "no we don't do that"...you don't do what, make money on your food? After she said that she turned around and walked away when I was still talking. She dropped off our cold food 30 minutes later and then our check 20 minutes after that. Not once did she check on us.  On top of the terrible service and value, our vegetables weren't cooked and the entirety of our meal was cool to the touch. It will be a very long time before we go back and never again will we sit there, nor will we have her as a waitress. So upset that we wasted our "cheat" meal on such a bad experience!  The sushi chef, however, was amazing and so friendly. He was the only bright spot in our meal.

nKPaW_3yeBc1D5ZohkIivw.text: Although I live 3 minutes from here I had never been to this location until last night. I brought my 5 year old son in for dinner and was not disappointed. Our server, Jonathan, was great from the start making sure we got our drinks in immediately & that my son was taken care of. Soup and salad was brought out promptly, and the chef came to the table about 15 mins after. Danny was great, he was funny and interacted with everyone. The food was great and we both had two full Togo boxes to take home- which made for a good lunch today! It wasn't that expensive compared to most Hibachi style restaurants and the quality was outstanding. Will definitely make this a more regular thing!

_hOhxk0RJHnP_rjf1pZNJA.text: It's been awhile since I wrote about my favorite Japanese dinning place.  In my opinion this place has it as the "Best of Charlotte " for Japanese food hands down!   The food is delicious every single time ! Portions are huge ! The entertainment is included and most times very fun ! Occasionally you'll get a chef who isn't too interactive but for the most part they'll engage you in a fun and entertaining dinner.   My go to favorite is the hibachi shrimp and recently I've become a fan of scallops! They do not disappoint!   The steak is always tender and flavorful! I recommend going for the filet as it is fabulous!   A delicious salad and a hot cup of onion soup start the experience and it's followed by a couple of shrimp appetizers to tease you !  The real deal is the fried rice ! It is yummy!  The chefs are very accommodating for those of you who don't want carbs .... simply let them know and it's more  for folks like me who go there for that yummy fried rice !  There's also a sushi bar if hibachi is not your thing. Fresh sushi is made each day and the chefs at the sushi bar are spot on fabulous!   Nakatos has been in Charlotte serving this delicious hibachi food since sometime in the 1980's.  I use to drive to their location off Independence Blvd back in the day.   So glad they moved ! But honestly it's worth the drive no matter where they go !  There's usually a short wait but they do take reservations!  If you have a group you'll get a whole table to yourselves and the experience is always great !   Check it out ! Sometimes if you watch your mail there's a coupon for 14.00 off a dinner of equal value!  If you've haven't been to Nakatos you're missing out on a fabulous find ! Two thumbs way up!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Favorite Japanese restaurant!
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad with ginger dressing
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soup

19137QjhSpcVMzyGpBa4hQ.text: It was a fun show getting to watch the chef work his magic on the grill. The only complaint was it got hot when they were cooking. It's an experience of a lifetime

I4NA6QiQkRscq3X1Y34oYQ.text: Let me start by saying, if you have a gift card, do a u turn. Secondly, our waitress acted like it was a huge burden to be a waitress that night. Finally, our chef was fine but not very engaging at all. Go to Kabutos. Seriously. The food was meh.  It's like they have been here so long they are like an old cranky relative.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

3pc9mMO5_z3fiIB-4lYq7Q.text: Thursday night is the best night to go. You don't have the huge crowds and the beers are cheaper. We like Nakato's when we want to go somewhere special but have no babysitter. The chef keeps the kids entertained and the food is good. I really like the dragon roll and we usually get edamame for the kids. Another great reason to go on Thursday is the early bird special. You get chicken and steak for a much cheaper price than on the weekend. I also order the spicy mustard sauce for my steak and sriracha for my shrimp. I recommend the fried rice over the white.

aX4xwP3gTf9hu7FGKVxmrw.text: You have, I believe, two choices in south Charlotte for hibachi style Japanese food where hibachi chefs prepare food at your table over a top grill. We opted for Nakatos and it was a good choice.  We seemed to feel the food was a bit better tasting.  For example,  the fried rice is prepared with 5 eggs which seems to be a lot more.  The noodles tasted fresher and the meats were well prepared and seasoned.   The appetizer soup was great as it had bits of fried tempura coating in it.  Overall great tasting food (5/5).  Plus you can sit at tables that are traditional as you have to take your shoes off which is cool (5/5). Overall great experience,  highly recommend you give this place a whirl of you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Birthday by strip fat with a couple of candles, lol.
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Birthday rice bowl
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fire

WeQr9IR6Lwhp4b4ArXWzjQ.text: Pretty yummy! Nakatos is probably my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I'm a frequent visitor to the university location but I was near the Pineville location and thought I would give it a try. It's a little smaller than the university location but so nice and clean. They have this cute little sushi section with boats that float on water. We were immediately seated on an early Saturday evening. Our server wasn't the best but the food was great and the cook was full of energy. They are definitely quick and efficient. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

QouQLnHVCGR4fgcojVjqlQ.text: I've heard rave reviews and they did not disappoint. I have to say my favorite part of the entire experience was receiving my sushi on a boat!! Both mine and my friend's rolls were really good. I would definitely return. Service was really good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States

Il1O5NJnL2oDYCIlQhXNCA.text: Always a good time and a great atmosphere for friends and family. Food is solid and the chef's are fun. Enjoy!

j25mflf2OVgo_kgcOXkAEA.text: The experience with the chefs is always top notch. The part that is also consistent is with the hosts. Its almost like they get mad at you for wanting to eat here. If you come in with no reservation and you have more than 2 people they do their absolute best to make you not want to stay and be their customer. Also years ago the hosts would dress nice and set a tone of a nice restaurant. Currently I see a waitress wearing a thick headband that looks like a bandanna and sport clothes while the other is fine but between guests is leaning on the wall , acting as if she can't wait until her shift is up and that she hates her life.

9fWyyhgRRq7ZDsVu0e8pxw.text: Another Japanese grill place. This one has a sushi boat bar. It was Monday so no sushi on the boats.   Ordered three rolls. The Spicy Snow

photos.caption: Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dojo
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charger
Photo of Nakato - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Snow

b99Hn-3Ofze6f-4_rTwB6g.text: I'd like to start by saying I've never had a bad experience at a hibachi restaurant...maybe occasionally the food was average but still fun...until I tried this place. Unbelievable!!!  Food is terrible. Hibachi chef left for 10 mins mid dinner to go to the back and get things he didn't have. They upcharge for everything. Service was incredibly slow.   I will never go back. I'd give it negative stars if I could. Thanks for a disappointing birthday dinner. Absolutely awful!    Please don't waste your time or money!!!!!

rpz_wIQ04AU8utElOdBeKQ.text: This place never disappoints!! They give you so much food and I always leave satisfied! Will definitely be back!

q1dv2nAQACj33qyCmaHxlA.text: After visiting Nakato again it was a much better experience, we had a nicer server and chef. The hostess was very nice and she seemed on top of things. The show was fun and food pretty good. The chicken was a little chewy but shrimp and rice were tasty. I still think their birthday package is stupid and they should sing and give at least kids a scoop of ice cream or something for free, for god sake youre paying $50+ for dinner!

tr9KBBPFI4U4YTIlr9TiAQ.text: I went to this place with my family on a Friday night and it was packed!  We were allowed to be seated faster if we decided Traditional Dining (basically sitting without your shoes).  Although it was interesting, I would probably not do it again.  I do not want to even know what my socks touched on those floors (even though the restaurant appeared pretty clean).    As far service, the waitress was nice and the chef was entertaining (pretty much the same as other Japanese restaurants).  As far as food, it was quite disappointing.  The soup was pretty good, but the salad was pretty bland, I didn't even finish it.  For the main course, I ordered the chicken and the NY strip steak.  When I saw the food right before it was going to be cooked, I could clearly see that food quality appeared sub-par.  The steaks were thin and were not that tasty, especially when I had mine cooked medium-rare.  The chicken was alright along with the rice and vegetables, but it was not memorable.    Overall, this Japanese restaurant was alright.  It's serves its purpose if you are craving Japanese food and do not want to drive far, but it is definitely not a place to go if you want to impress someone.

ECJnqs9a9GvNIYx-PCfipw.text: We came in just for sushi and, while I know their main feature is the hibachi grill-style cooking, they also advertise themselves as a "sushi bar" in huge letters on their building. If you promote yourself as a sushi establishment, the product should be of decent quality.  Red flag #1 was the fact there were only 3 total rolls sitting on the 20 or so sushi boats.  They had a separate sushi menu, so it was fine... just odd for this type of sushi bar.  We know sushi/sashimi very well and their fish was NOT fresh, at all.  It borderline smelled fishy and it was pretty mushy.  It hadn't gone bad... yet.  But it was almost there.  Further, spicy tuna should be diced with some texture, not a paste.  It was gross.  My husband was so grossed out he stopped eating after trying only one or two bites of each roll. He has never refused to eat sushi in the 18 years we have eaten sushi together. This was a first.  On the upside, the food is very reasonably-priced and the staff was pleasant and attentive.  That is the only reason I gave 2 stars instead of just 1.  Unfortunately, we will not be back.

ygSVLUH_Z5kEOseSVB_PEA.text: Skip Nakato and go to Kabutos instead. If you decide to eat at Nakato's make sure you call in for reservations . We walked in without reservations and were told it was an hour wait. Nancy, the hostess, reminded us 5 times during our hour and 25 minute wait the "you were a walk in". Apparently you can walk into the parking lot, call in a reservation, and will be seated before a low life walk in. The nerve of someone thinking it's ok to just walk in, give your name and expect any form of decent customer service. Finally after waiting an shout and 25 minutes, watching walk ins who just arrived 10 minutes earlier be seated, we decided Kabutos, just 1/2 a mile South should have been where we went in the first place. Went there and we were greeted with a smile and someone who was excited to have our business. Dinner was fantastic!skip Nakatos and go straight to Kabutos

GqWPhnucAZbwqRjzRXpUeA.text: The food was absolutely terrible. Salmon in the Philadelphia roll was brown, Miso soup was nothing but beef broth, Crunchy shrimp roll had a plastic taste to it like it was frozen and thawed out a couple times, Chicken teriyaki was as dry as the Gobi desert

55Iib2Nds_40BiU_E7ccsA.text: Ider is a lot of fun and an awesome cook! We had a wonderful experience.  We will definitely request him when we come back in June and July!

jEdrfQTkanEp00KM1BG0Ow.text: If you like Asian cuisine and ambience this is the place. The sushi chef has great dishes and is always eager to please. Sometimes there is a wait but the host work hard to get you seated as soon as possible. The food is delicious and can be prepared to personal choice. Worth checking out. Go mid week to avoid the crowd. Weekends are always packed. If going on the weekend make reservations. Be sure to call at least 2 hours before going. Your choices will dictate the cost. Enjoy

0NGq7bh60UED2UGpKXCwZg.text: This is one of our favorite places to eat for birthdays and other occasions.  Love the food and entertainment.  The restaurant stays busy. It's a lot of fun. The one negative is the wait staff. Not that friendly and hard to get their attention.

6DuQ16Jb4F6wIGmk0WUSjg.text: It was hard for me to rate this place. I am not really a good judge of this style of food. However service, entertainment, prices are great. The food was good but a sauces were just a bit to heavy and salty for my taste. I would rate it better than OK but I am not really a fan.

ZAGzQIAj6_Zu9b3Dl9mRFw.text: We have eaten here uncountable times typically about 6-8 times a year. And after our experience on Saturday my husband refuses to go back. The portions were tiny, the food had no flavor and the sauces were all watered down. I understand times are tuff but, come on watering down your shrimp sauce, ginger sauce and salad dressing. Made for a less than appealing meal. We always have left overs and for the first time ever we ate all of our food even the rice and was on the verge of still being hungry. Very disappointed and in fact it will take a lot of convincing to get my husband to go back.

lqJ9WpcSCKVZtwjfQVdbcQ.text: I enjoyed the show, the food, and the company. The soup was a tasty broth. The show started with some shrimp, then noodles and veggies. After that, the main course. For me it was shrimp hibachi (), my friend got steak hibachi. She let me try some of hers and it was good as well. Never had an empty glass and left with a midnight snack. Would definitely return.

8iHp-5mkjIlPcLAkUL0G9w.text: Fantastic.  The bartender was excellent.  Service was great.  Our chef was awesome.  And the food was amazing!  We'll definitely be back!

L9xnWAhxIFNnq5P0P3IMSQ.text: Have been to Nakato for dinner numerous times and have enjoyed it every time. The menu is exactly what you expect at a Japanese steakhouse. The wait staff is friendly and the chefs have a good time while preparing your food. definitely worth checking out.

5vUiR5m5Wri0fLdmBziRIQ.text: I went with a party and will only discuss my experience with the food. I purchased Teriyaki Steak for dinner. In came a platter with 12 one-inch cubes of steak with no seasoning, no teriyaki sauce, no sauce of any kind. It came with a mound of rice--that was very tasty--but no veggies. And all this plethora of food was $16. Very disappointed that the food is average, beginner chef stuff. Nakato in Pineville needs to take their food to the next level and offer flavor with every bite. Include savory, in-season, seasoned veggies with all meals to help the customer feel they have gotten their money's worth when they pay $16 for a meal. I ended up bringing it home, adding onions, green/yellow squash, and sliced carrots, along with some Chinese teriyaki sauce with a shake of red pepper. Voila.

s29CmrvYoJ3BUrFznKOo9A.text: Favorite place to get sushi!  Service is always great. We sit at the sushi bar unless  we take our child   she loves to watch them cook. They are very accommodating. Decent drinks!   Loves the volcano roll

OBlTmPVZ1_1CUI0Zflny-A.text: Nakato is my favorite Japanese restaurant in Charlotte. I like the filet mignon and lobster. High quality ingredients prepared fresh right in front of you. I really enjoy eating at Nakato!

-R5832EM50nDQyD1vnLqzw.text: I had been to the University location several times and that one is great.  The one in Pineville, although decent, is not as good.  The food was ok but the chicken was dry.  The sushi was decent.  They have great sanitation grades, but there is some wear and tear on the floors near the tables and throughout the restaurant.  They could use a renovation.  Much prefer the University location.  For Japanese steakhouses in South Charlotte, I'll stick with Fuji at Rivergate.  However, if I 'm on the north side of town, I will go to that Nakato's.

Nzqoin7MopClrTYIOySJhw.text: I LOVE their hibachi dinners!  The veggies, noodles, soup, shrimp and fried rice are all delicious.  I'm pretty much addicted to their Yum Yum Sauce (Shrimp Sauce).  I put that on everything.  Definitely not a place to go if you are counting your calories.  I enjoy their hot sake as well.  My boyfriend and I frequent this location for birthdays and anniversaries.  They get packed on Friday and Saturday nights so we always make a reservation to avoid waiting.  Definitely one of my favorite hibachi restaurants!

cZ1UsiySU8HLtggPD9cG3w.text: The best sushi I have ever had!!! This restaurant is 3 hours away and we will make special trips to eat here. The restaurant is beautiful, the sushi chefs are very friendly and knowledgable, and the servers are quick and attentive. Definitely sit at the sushi bar!

uTrpdbBJXx1Mg783iXi6rQ.text: Decent prices, good food, portions keep getting smaller....but the kicker is the horrible service you'll receive! We always give places more than one shot, especially if their food is good...but every time we go we are so disappointed at the service!  The chefs are nice and entertaining, especially for kids, but their servers don't seem to care and ruin the tip (which they split)  This last time, we went on a Friday round 6. Moderately busy, but seated right away. Our server seemed so bothered by us, never saying you're welcome when we thanked it (it was more if a grunt/irritated "ya") and the portions were much smaller. I swear, the more people at a table, the smaller the portion. If you get served last, expect to be jealous of the first persons huge serving.   They charged an extra $1.75 for fried rice, which I don't mind but I do expect more than 2 pieces of broccoli, one mushroom and a decent amount of zucchini and onion. My chicken dinner cost around $16, and the best part was the Shrimp sauce,    They served my husbands combo with teryaki chicken instead of regular hibachi and when he told them it was wrong twice, our chef pretended not to hear and turned the fan on. We were so annoyed at that point, we didn't push the issue...paid our $50 tab and bolted.   Won't be returning. Given this place too many opportunities and they constantly fail.

jnnwS2KmRz2M1pZTwJlctQ.text: This isn't the best and it isn't the worst in the food department, but for the cost, location, and service, I would much rather spend my hard earned dough at other hibachi places in the area! If you know no other hibachi steakhouses, you'll like this a lot, but if you're accustomed to smiling faces, interactive chefs and higher quality sushi and options, keep searching for another place!

bHD80pw7FpOBgkyDyjKoPg.text: I went here with a friend, she had a groupon. Normally it was a little pricey so if I go back it would be for lunch. We got a big portion of food. You start with a ginger broth which was surprisingly quite tasty. Then comes a salad w/ a strong ginger dressing, but it grew on me, then u get a shrimp appetizer. You get a shrimp sauce which was really good & a ginger sauce which wasn't great. I dipped everything in the shrimp sauce. Then comes the stir fried veggies which were my favorite. Then the noodles, rice (steamed or fried) the steamed was better. And finally the meat of your choice. I had teriyaki chicken, great flavor. Overall I enjoyed the food & the preparation was entertaining to say the least.

1j3ubaMAxLIAcT8xjwTI6g.text: Saturday night: had party for 12 people and were treated poorly. We felt rushed as though they couldn't wait to get us out so the next group could sit down. Food quality was average at best. Would not recommend this restaurant if you want to enjoy a leisurely dinner.

lIf923wBbDah1jGSCZxMZg.text: Terrible service I have been her for 2 hours and no one has said anything ready to leave. I wanted to try something different then kabutos and I was wrong if ever deciding between the two choice kabuto's

T_XHtEKSPNc_nPI2t1ZjJA.text: Now the food was Good! On the other hand the service from staff was HORRIBLE!! They were VERY rude and the hosts who greet you at the door are extremely lazy and not to mention RACIST. If you want fried rice with your Hibachi, IT COSTS EXTRA, who does that????If you don't want to serve your customers at least put on a front that you care about those you are serving. At the end of the day, if you want great food they have it. If you want HORRIBLE service from a restaurant trust me NAKATO can provide that for you as well. One Star for Good food and believe me FIRST IMPRESSIONS ARE LASTING. Wont be back! AT ALL!

8cBR4wJPSRbGX941wmReig.text: overall food and service is what you would expect from a Japanese style steak house. What bugs me, is the fact that they menu is not up to date. We dined at 5:30 p.m. In order to get the early bird special as shown on the menu. When I ordered the early bird special which is a steak and chicken combo, the waitress told me they no longer do the early bird special. I asked her how long they have stopped doing this and she said Oh it has been a long time. But obviously they have not updated their menu to reflect the change in what they offer. So beware the menu does not reflect the True reality at this restaurant.

JCB_-6jQTnOzPhXfVmT-1Q.text: Very disappointing. Too expensive for what you get. They were just going through the motions without any emotion. Food had no flavor. A lot of veggies very little steak or chicken. My son and I ordered different chicken but both orders were prepared the same. Had to ask for more water. Still eating when take home boxes were brought out. I felt like I had wasted my hard earned money.

Z0mwTznD3YKwcSbUp0wJEg.text: Good Hibachi, MaiTai was fantastic and the service was efficient and family friendly.  I normally go for grown and sexy but I was in for a different vibe.  My girlfriend and I had a baby with us and the environment was perfect for it.  Go early otherwise you may wait for a long time.

x_dsrM5FCNSdVDNPvqk2dg.text: Now don't get me wrong I love the food, and the chef/cook was great entertainment. They also had a decent special when I went, I got the chicken and shrimp which was good, my hubby got the steak and chicken and he finished his plate so I'm assuming he enjoyed his too. We also had a couple cocktails that were pretty good too. Its a cute little place too, no different than any other but its still nice. I think their tables are a little small though. I felt like I was so close to the couple next to me. I suggest you go on a rainy day or make a reservation because when we went we ended up waiting like 20mins before we were seated and it was just jam packed. They also have a small parking lot.

b8ppI_mUJqYOuNDzGSelKw.text: We went to Nakato last night for dinner.  The food was average in taste, much smaller portions and higher prices than before, and the service was not good at all.  We waited a long time for our courses and forever for our check.  My wife had to remind the waiter that she hadn't gotten her sushi order.  We had a coupon and they added 18% for a gratuity, per the coupon, which we didn't see beforehand -- the coupon is a scam so watch out.  We wouldn't have tipped that much based on the above comments.  Our table mates asked for a birthday greeting which never happened.  Yes, we have been eating here for 15 plus years but likely will not return as things have declined so much recently.  No one ever came to our table to ask how things were going -- a sign of poor customer relations.
